intro: Montanoa palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's montanoa, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Montanoa palmeri is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
